leitej.util.stream

Interface RandomAccessBinaryItf

  • All Superinterfaces:

    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BigBinaryData, BinaryFile

extends java.io.Closeable

    • Method Detail

      • read

        int read(long offset)
  throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
         java.io.IOException
        Throws:

      • read

        int read(long offset,
         byte[] buff)
  throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
         java.lang.NullPointerException,
         java.io.IOException
        Reads up to buff.length bytes of data from this file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.

        Although FilePieces is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[], int, int) method of InputStream.

        Parameters:
        offset - the first byte of the file to be read
        buff - the buffer into which the data is read
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If buff is null
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the random access file has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException

      • read

        int read(long offset,
         byte[] buff,
         int off,
         int len)
  throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
         java.lang.NullPointerException,
         java.io.IOException
        Reads up to len bytes of data from this file into an array of bytes. This method blocks until at least one byte of input is available.

        Although FilePieces is not a subclass of InputStream, this method behaves in exactly the same way as the InputStream.read(byte[], int, int) method of InputStream.

        Parameters:
        offset - the first byte of the file to be read
        buff - the buffer into which the data is read
        off - the start offset in array b at which the data is written
        len - the maximum number of bytes read
        Returns:
        the total number of bytes read into the buffer, or -1 if there is no more data because the end of the file has been reached
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException - If off is negative, len is negative, or len is greater than b.length - off
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If buff is null
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the random access file has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

      • write

        void write(long offset,
           byte[] buff)
    throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
           java.io.IOException
        Writes buff.length bytes from the specified byte array to this file at fileOff position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the first byte of the file to be written
        buff - the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException

      • write

        void write(long offset,
           byte[] buff,
           int off,
           int len)
    throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
           java.io.IOException
        Writes len bytes from the specified byte array to this file at fileOff position.
        Parameters:
        offset - the first byte of the file to be written
        buff - the data
        off - the start offset in the data
        len - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException
